Articles.Content:
i saw this physical display on amazon

http://www.amazon.com/Mad-Catz-PZ46-Flight-Instrument/dp/B000VLNXRU/ref=sr_1_20?ie=UTF8&qid=1376815037&sr=8-20&keywords=flight+stick

and was wondering if anyone knew how to get somthing like this to work with ksp. since i dont have the skills to build one like i see some other people doing i thought this might be a better idea. but cant figure out if it would even work.
There are several projects working towards this goal.
All it would take is some simple plugin programming to output the necessary data to the display, all stuff you can learn from the KSP wiki if you have at least some basic knowledge of programming.

Yeah, pretty sure I saw a thread on this at some point. Might've just been a question about how people felt about KSP-themed physical displays. I'm not that into simming or immersing myself into KSP(though I do get really into it >.> ) so I didn't really take interest in that particular thread.

I'd say search it and see what people thought, I think it went for a few pages of replies

wow I'd KILL to have a physical nav-ball!

that'd be insanely difficult to build, though

maybe even just a small little separate display for the nav-ball would be cool.
